data/blueprints.xml.append$/FTL/FTL[1]/s: THIS IS A BUG. REPORT IT ALONG WITH THE EVENT AND SECTOR.
data/blueprints.xml.append$/FTL/FTL[1]/c: Resilience and determination makes them take less damage from the environment
data/blueprints.xml.append$/FTL/FTL[2]/w: This simple burst laser isn't flashy but it gets the job done.
Slightly improved version of the burst laser that fires more shots per charge.
Powerful burst laser that fires off an impressive barrage.
Heavy lasers can wreak more havoc than their smaller, burst laser counterparts
This heavy laser fires two shots in quick succession, each dealing 2 damage.
Creative missile design allows for two projectiles for the cost of one!
These missiles are designed to cause maximum destruction to ship hull armor.
Can cut across entire ships, assuming there's no shield to stop it.
Slow but reliably powerful standard beam weapon.
One of the most powerful weapons of war ever created. Known to take out some ships in a single blast.
This terrifying beam does no physical damage but ignites fires.
This terrifying beam does no physical damage but rips through organic material, dealing heavy damage to crewmembers.
A powerful laser designed to maximize hull damage.
This powerful counterpart to the Hull Smasher Mark I fires more projectiles per shot.
This beam is most powerful when targeting large, empty sections of hull.
High hull damage plus a decent breach chance.
Ion weapons can disable systems without causing hull damage.
Ion weapons can disable systems without causing hull damage.
Ion weapons can disable systems without causing hull damage.
Self-teleporting explosive that damages systems and crew but not the hull. Can target your own ship.
Slower than Mark I but does more damage to systems and crew. Can target your own ship.
Self-teleporting explosive designed to damage crew-members and light fires. Can target your own ship.
Self-teleporting explosive that uses ion damage to disable systems. Can target your own ship.
Self-teleporting healing unit that instantly heals all friendly crew in the room. Can target your own ship.
data/blueprints.xml.append$/FTL/FTL[2]/d: Powerful drone that continually attacks the enemy ship.
Powerful drone that continually attacks the enemy ship. Moves and shoots faster than Mark I.
Combat drone that repeatedly attacks with a small beam weapon
Automatically repairs 3-5 damage to your hull. Drone part is consumed once it finishes.
Shoots down incoming missiles, asteroids, and flak debris.
It fires faster than Mark I and can also shoot down incoming lasers.
Will seek out damaged systems and repair them automatically.
Will seek out and attempt to destroy any intruders on-board your ship.
Breaches through the enemy hull and wreaks havoc. Awesome.
data/blueprints.xml.append$/FTL/FTL[2]/a: Reverse Ion Field
Protects your ship from ion damage, giving a 50% chance to negate it entirely.
Stealth Weapons
Prevents your weapon fire from disrupting your cloak, allowing you to shoot at will while cloaked.
Repair Arm
Repairs your hull every time you collect scrap, but reduces scrap collected by 15%.
Scrap Recovery Arm
Allows the ship to collect 10% more scrap from any source.
Long-Ranged Scanners
Adds additional info about nearby Beacons on the star map.
Automated Re-loader
Cooldown between weapon shots is improved by 10 percent.
Shield Charge Booster
Boosts the ship's shield recharge rate by 15 percent.
Weapon Pre-igniter
Weapons are made immediately available after an FTL jump.
FTL Recharge Booster
The ship's FTL Drive powers up 25 percent faster.
Adv. FTL Navigation
Allows the ship to jump to any previously visited Beacon.
Drone Recovery Arm
Non-destroyed drones will be retrieved when jumping, allowing their parts to be reused.
FTL Jammer
Scramble enemy ships' FTL computers, doubling the time it takes for them to jump.
data/blueprints.xml.append$/FTL/FTL[2]/c: Humans are common and uninteresting, but very skilled.
It's unclear if the 'Engi' are partly organic or entirely mechanical, but it's well known that they make exceptional engineers.
The Mantis disregard for individual lives led to their evolution as a vicious warrior race.
These telepathic Slugs were shunned in the Galactic Federation for their constant thievery and attempts at manipulation.
Telepathic powers reveal rooms and lifeforms even when sensors are down.
The 'Rockmen' of Vrachos IV are rarely seen and are known for their fortitude.
The 'Zoltan' are allies of the 'Engi.' Their innate energy can power ship systems.
15 damage to enemy crew on death

Resilience and determination makes them take less damage from the environment

Regenerates health very slowly after a short delay when not fighting

Disciplined Rebel troops willing to risk it all to bring you to an end.

The Separatist Engis have broken free from the control of the Harmony, a widespread program that controls the Engis and encourages sameness.
Active Ability: Toggles to nanite mode where it ignores doors, resists mind control, and becomes damage resistant, but cannot fight or repair
These hard-light entities might be part of the Federation, but they're also known for their strict rules and formal attitudes.

Active Ability: Spawns in a temporary holographic ally that provides additional power. Can spawn up to two allies per jump.
Crazed terrorists in ornamental clothing with only one thing in mind - death to the Ministry.
Active Ability: Spawns in a temporary holographic ally that provides additional power. Can spawn up to two allies per jump.

Distant cousins to the Slugs, the Shells possess unique explosive characteristics, but have a heavy reliance on oxygen.
Active Ability: Combusts violently, taking heavy self-damage and damaging nearby enemy crew and systems. Slowly regenerates health afterwards.
The Shell scientists are genetically engineered to provide medical assistance to nearby crew, and work hard to uncover the secrets of life in their free time.
Active Ability: Combusts, taking heavy self damage but fully healing all nearby crew. Regenerates back health afterwards.
The Shell mechanics maintain Shell facilities and infrastructure. Their organic bodies have been cybernetically enhanced, and can disperse nanobots when necessary.
Active Ability: Combusts, taking heavy self damage but fully repairing the current system. Slowly regenerates back health afterwards.
The Shell guardians are the members of the Shell Military district. Well armored, but lacking the usual regenerative properties of the Shells.
Active Ability: Takes heavier self damage but does 30 crew damage and 2 system damage to enemy systems. Rather than regenerating, fortifies itself temporarily, taking 0.3x damage for the duration.
The Mantis disregard for individual lives led to their evolution as a vicious warrior race.
The friendly Free Mantis have rebelled from the Hive, and now live their lives independent and addicted to their synthesized pheromones.

Stunned for half the usual duration
A dangerous Rockman refugee who was banished for opposing the Rockman Elders.

The devoted Rockmen followers of the Cult of the Eternal Ember.
Active Ability: Sacrifices 75 health for temporarily boosted stats
The ancestors and sister-species of the Rockmen, known for both their elegance and their narcissism.
Active Ability (2 charges): Locks down rooms. Each cast costs 7 health.
Members of the SSLG organization, sent by the Empress to help liberate the Rockmen from the tyrannical Theocracy.

data/blueprints.xml.append$/FTL/FTL[4]/F: Weapon Control
Powers all of the ship's weapons. Upgrading lets you power more weapons.
Shields
Powers your shields. Each additional barrier can block one shot.
Engines
Powers the FTL drive and allows the ship to dodge. Upgrading improves dodge chance and the rate that your FTL drive charges.
Oxygen
Refills the oxygen in the ship. Upgrading increases the rate of refill.
Crew Teleporter
Allows you to send your crew-members to board enemy vessels. [IMPORTANT: level 4 can be upgraded at empty beacons if you are already at level 3.]
Medbay
Heals all crew-members within the Medbay room. Upgrading increases healing speed.
Clone Bay
Automatically clones dead crew with skill penalty. Taking advantage of micro-cloning, crew heals partially every jump. Jump heal is passive and requires no power.
Drone Control
Powers all of the ship's drones. Drones are automated robots that perform tasks like attacking enemy ships or repairing systems.
Cloaking
Cloaks the ship, adding 60 to your evasion and preventing the enemy ship from locking on with their weapons. [IMPORTANT: level 3, 4, and 5 can be upgraded at empty beacons.]
Hacking
Targets a single system, locking its doors and granting the ability to temporarily disable or disrupt it. Requires drone part to launch.
Mind Control
Temporarily turn enemies into allies, allowing you to control them and take advantage of their effects.
Artillery Beam
Powers a slow, high-powered beam that pierces all shields and does one damage per room hit. More power means faster cooldown.
Temporal Manipulator
Changes the rate of time in one room. Upgrading increases duration and time dilation strength.
Piloting
Allows the ship to make FTL jumps and dodge when piloted. Upgrading adds auto-pilot that allows some evasion even without a pilot.
Sensors
Reveals the interior of your ship and gives information about enemy ships.
Door System
Allows remote opening and closing of doors. Upgrades to Blast Doors that impede fire spread and intruder movement.
Backup Battery
Provides a 30 second power boost to your Reactor. Upgrading increases the boost amount.
FTL Fuel
Powers your FTL drive. One jump per fuel.
Missile
Multipurpose ammo for any missile based weapon.
Drone Part
Allows you to deploy drone schematics you've found. Each deployment costs one drone part.

Crew gain a 1% boost to health.
Crew do not lose skills when cloned.
Crew heal at 1hp/s in the teleporter.
Crew gain 60% stun resistance on your own ship.
Crew can now ignore hacked doors on your own ship.
All of your systems and your hull gain a 10% chance to resist damage.
Crew repair your drone control 75% faster.
Crew gain 30% damage resistance in the doors room and enemy crew sabotage your doors 50% slower.
Crew are immune to mind control in the piloting room.
When your backup battery is disabled your crew gain a bonus 33% repair and movement speed.
You have a 7% chance to ignore the cost of a missile weapon.
You have a 15% chance of breaking off a crystal shard each time you take damage.
All crew you get will start at lvl 1 skills.
Ruin beacons show on the map.
Enemy FTLs charge at half speed.
All of your crew gain a 4% boost to their health and repair speed for each crew member you have.
You may avoid fighting any Renegade for free, regular or cruiser.
C.U.R.A. will not charge you the next run.
data/blueprints.xml.append$/FTL/FTL[6]/F: [Level 1] Has a 5% chance to prevent hull or system damage. However, at empty beacons it can be upgraded. Can be increased to a max of 80%.
[Level 2] Has a 10% chance to prevent hull or system damage. However, at empty beacons it can be upgraded. Can be increased to a max of 80%.
[Level 3] Has a 15% chance to prevent hull or system damage. However, at empty beacons it can be upgraded. Can be increased to a max of 80%.
[Level 4] Has a 20% chance to prevent hull or system damage. However, at empty beacons it can be upgraded. Can be increased to a max of 80%.
[Level 5] Has a 25% chance to prevent hull or system damage. However, at empty beacons it can be upgraded. Can be increased to a max of 80%.
[Level 6] Has a 30% chance to prevent hull or system damage. However, at empty beacons it can be upgraded. Can be increased to a max of 80%.
[Level 7] Has a 35% chance to prevent hull or system damage. However, at empty beacons it can be upgraded. Can be increased to a max of 80%.
[Level 8] Has a 40% chance to prevent hull or system damage. However, at empty beacons it can be upgraded. Can be increased to a max of 80%.
[Level 9] Has a 45% chance to prevent hull or system damage. However, at empty beacons it can be upgraded. Can be increased to a max of 80%.
[Level 10] Has a 50% chance to prevent hull or system damage. However, at empty beacons it can be upgraded. Can be increased to a max of 80%.
[Level 11] Has a 60% chance to prevent hull or system damage. However, at empty beacons it can be upgraded. Can be increased to a max of 80%.
[Level 12] Has a 70% chance to prevent hull or system damage. However, at empty beacons it can be upgraded. Can be increased to a max of 80%.
[Level 13] Has a 80% chance to prevent hull or system damage. However, at empty beacons it can be upgraded. A special ability can be selected.
[Level MAX] Has an 80% chance to prevent hull or system damage. Also has a 20% chance to ignore ion damage.
[Level MAX] Has an 80% chance to prevent hull or system damage. Also repairs breaches automatically.
[Level MAX] Has an 80% chance to prevent hull or system damage. Also has a 30% chance to break off a crystal shard when the hull is damaged.
Allows the ship to jump to any previously visited beacon, and reveals details about surrounding beacons.
You shouldn't be seeing this yet.

An Aether powered FTL Drive recovered from precursor wreckage, using technology that isn't possible on most planes of reality. Allows you to jump to any beacon, regardless of if it has been visited before for 1 fuel and makes your FTL drive charge much faster. However, due to the experimental nature of the augment, will cause 1 damage to your hull and engines every jump.
A reverse engineered copy of an Aether Drive. Allows you to jump to any beacon, regardless of if it has been visited before. Costs 3 fuel to jump to any non-adjacent beacon.

Allows you to fabricate multiple Magnetic Payload augments for the price of 20 scrap and 5 missiles at empty beacons.
	
	[X] - As an external system upgrade, this augment will provide its normal effect but take up an augment slot. Can be converted for free to the internal version under the internal upgrade menu.
Allows you to fabricate multiple Magnetic Payload augments for the price of 20 scrap and 5 missiles at empty beacons.
A beaten up ATM machine that grants 2 scrap every time you make a jump. Does not trigger the effects of Repair or Scrap arms.
An Obelisk Reality Manipulator tuned to pull cans of beans from other realities. If Sylvan Prime is aboard, he can convert them back to Sylvan.

In the case of imminent catastrophic hull failure at less than 3 hull, will trigger emergency protocols that will immediately repair the hull back to full and replenish fuel, missile, and drone part supplies. Will only trigger once before being depleted. Will not save you if your hull instantly reaches 0.

Hektar Industries(tm) introduces the Hektar Virtual Store Interface(tm)! Remotely access Hektar's vast stock of modules and modular weapons, purchase a blueprint, and print it about aboard your own ship with the included Hektar 3D Fabrication technology(tm)! Prices include those required for the raw materials needed for fabrication.
Can be activated before combat at the price of 5 missiles, dealing 15 damage to both you and the enemy.

For a hefty cost of 8 fuel, before combat you can activate the secondary drive to immediately escape combat. Each Engine upgrade past level 4 will reduce the fuel cost by 1. However, due to instability, every 5 damage you take at a beacon will cause fires to start onboard.
Special adaptive plating that has a 25% chance to protect your systems or hull from all forms of damage. Also gives 10% ion resistance.
Allows you to breed two tamed equinoids to create a new, untamed equinoid for free at empty beacons.

The ever present Separatist whom ensures the protection of all equinoids. Will manually control and repair the ship even in the absence of crew, and do massive damage to boarders while also quickly repairing breaches and putting out fires.
Special suits that allow crew to move faster by 25%.
Weapons will no longer decrease the current cloak duration. Additionally, boosts weapon cooldown rate by 12%.
Allows you to generate extra fuel with solar energy. You can use this at empty beacons to find a star to generate fuel and missiles, at the risk of starting fires on your ship.
Can be used to detect Elite Rebel ships which you can hunt down and kill. However, doing so will also boost the Rebel fleet by 1 jump.
Surprisingly resistant golden plating that has a 15% chance to ignore hull damage. Also allows you to take apart a portion of the hull at empty beacons for extra scrap.
Scrap gains are reduced by 50%, but before combat the hull can be repaired for free.
A damaged piece of ancient tech that can reach through space and time to retrieve lifeforms from other realities. Seems only able to lock onto Ghosts for now...
Allows you to unthaw more Osmian crew at empty beacons at the expense of 5 fuel.

A secluded place for two members of a species to "Form a union" and to use cloning technology to create a "Child" who is aged just enough to be able to work. Also come equipped with a stereo system that plays RnB music 24/7.
A modified pod that not only functions like standard Pleasure Pods, but also lets you summon any of the Alpha Ghost variants at the expense of 2 fuel if you have none of that type on your ship.

Your crew might be working for the Federation now, but they still carry with them their old Rebel prejudice. Human crew gain a 33% buff to all main stats, but alien crew have a 40% loss to all main stats. (Main stats include health, damage, repair, sabotage, and movement speed).
Dispenses nanobots that both heal your crew when the Medbay is powered as well as damage enemy boarders.
Contrary to the usual purpose of armor, this plating is extremely fragile. It'll break off into 2 smaller shards every time it is hit, though they can only pierce 2 shields each.
A strangely resistant shield powered by several massive Aether batteries with an integrity of 12 hitpoints.
A strangely resistant shield powered by several massive Aether batteries with an integrity of 12 hitpoints.
A strangely resistant shield powered by several massive Aether batteries with an integrity of 12 hitpoints.
A strangely resistant shield powered by several massive Aether batteries with an integrity of 20 hitpoints.
YOU SHOULD NEVER SEE THIS - makes crew very heavy
Your hull has a 50% resist chance.

Makes systems extra protected from Ghost erosion, reducing their sabotage damage by 20%. If a Door Control system is present, all enemy crew and drones on-board (including anaerobic crew) will take a base damage of 4hp/s with an extra 1hp for each level of Door Control above 1.
Superior hull armor provides a 17% chance to negate incoming hull damage (hit systems will still be damaged). Provides an opportunity to ram the enemy ship before combat as well.
Superior hull armor provides a 20% chance to negate incoming hull damage (hit systems will still be damaged). Provides an opportunity to ram the enemy ship before combat as well.

Extremely strong armor reinforced with Aether harvested from precursor ruins, fused with the already resistant armor of the Rockmen. Resists all hull damage from normal weapons, but cannot resist breach weapons. Provides an opportunity to ram the enemy ship before combat as well.

Extremely strong armor reinforced with Aether harvested from precursor ruins, fused with the already resistant armor of the Rockmen. Has a 70% chance to resist hull damage, but cannot resist breach weapons. Provides an opportunity to ram the enemy ship before combat as well.
Strange plating that can resist all ion damage and gives a very small chance for systems to resist damage.

An advanced Lost Sun creation, a superior hull plating which not only protects the hull, but patches breaches automatically. Has a 10% chance to resist hull damage. Provides an opportunity to ram the enemy ship before combat as well.

An advanced Lost Sun creation, a superior hull plating which not only protects the hull, but patches breaches automatically. Has a 10% chance to resist hull damage. Provides an opportunity to ram the enemy ship before combat as well.
Every time your ship takes damage, there is a 33% chance to break off a shard that flies at your enemy.
Every time your ship takes damage, there is a 75% chance to break off a shard that flies at your enemy which pierces all shields.
Every time your ship takes damage, there is a 75% chance to break off a shard that flies at your enemy which pierces all shields.
Advanced hard-light technology creates this nearly impenetrable shield. Only the energy outburst from an FTL engine is powerful enough to recharge it.
Advanced hard-light technology creates this nearly impenetrable shield. Only the energy outburst from an FTL engine is powerful enough to recharge it.

Repurposed Aether technology from the traditional Zoltan shields, which instead reroutes power across the ship. Provides a 50% chance to resist ion damage, a 50% reduction to stun duration on your own ship, and increases the maximum number of charges and charges gained per jump your crew members' active abilities have by 2.

Slug ships excrete a thick gel that repairs breaches faster than regular sealant. Coats the inside of empty rooms, providing 35% combat resistance and 50% hazard resistance to crew inside them. Also provides a cheaper option for repairs at empty beacons.

Slug ships excrete a thick gel that repairs breaches faster than regular sealant. Coats the inside of empty rooms, providing 35% combat resistance and 50% hazard resistance to crew inside them. Also provides a cheaper option for repairs at empty beacons.

REVOLUTIONARY brand new variant of Slug Repair Gel produced exclusively by Hektar Industries(tm) with a little bit of lizard mixed in to give it that signature aroma. 
	
	Crew move 20% slower in empty rooms, but allied crew take 50% less damage from all sources in them and also benefit from 50% stun resistance. Also provides a cheaper option for repairs at empty beacons.

You're pretty sure this is Repair Gel... but you can't really be certain. 
	
	Crew move 20% slower in empty rooms, but allied crew take 50% less damage from all sources in them and also benefit from 50% stun resistance. Also provides a cheaper option for repairs at empty beacons.
Strength inducing pheromones that are dispersed through the Life Support system. Each powered level provides an additional 25% boost to movement and a 6.25% boost to Max Health.
Strength inducing pheromones that are dispersed through the Life Support system. Each powered level provides an additional 25% boost to movement and a 6.25% boost to Max Health.
Special pheromones concocted by the Free Mantis. Each level of the Life Support system that is powered provides a 15% combat damage boost, but for each level above 1 also reduces repair speed by 25%.
Special pheromones concocted by the Free Mantis. Each level of the Life Support system that is powered provides a 15% combat damage boost, but for each level above 1 also reduces repair speed by 25%.

The strongest concoction ever brewed by the Free Mantis, for the biggest of vibes. All crew gain a 20% damage and 100% movement speed boost, but ability cooldowns take 50% longer and non-Free Mantis crew lose 10% health.
Strength inducing pheromones that are dispersed through the Life Support system. Each powered level reduces active ability cooldowns by 15% and increases movement speed by 33%.
Strength inducing pheromones that are dispersed through the Life Support system. Each powered level reduces active ability cooldowns by 15% and increases movement speed by 33%.
A small on-board greenhouse for growing kernel ammunition. Gives a 65% chance to not use ammunition when a missile based weapon is fired. Also lets you recover 1 fuel for every sector transition.
A small on-board greenhouse for growing kernel ammunition. Gives a 65% chance to not use ammunition when a missile based weapon is fired. Also lets you recover 1 fuel for every sector transition.
Floods the ship with toxic spores that weaken enemies, increasing their vulnerability to all damage by 20%.
Floods the ship with toxic spores that weaken enemies, increasing their vulnerability to all damage by 20%.
A database of various DNA samplings, which your Morphs can use to transform into any of the included species. DNA Samples may be used any number of times.
An odorous and very unpleasant gas that acts like a neurotoxin. Slowly kills non-Shell/Vampweed enemy boarders; your own crew is immune.
An odorous and very unpleasant gas that acts like a neurotoxin. Slowly kills non-Shell/Vampweed enemy boarders; your own crew is immune.
An incredibly deadly and fast-working neurotoxin that will rapidly kill any non-Shell/Vampweed hostile crew on your ship.

A specialized gas formula mixed with nanites that flood through the ventilation. They won't harm your own crew, but will passively damage non-Shell/Vampweed enemy boarders. Also actively put out fires and repair breaches.

A specialized gas formula mixed with nanites that flood through the ventilation. They won't harm your own crew, but will passively damage non-Shell/Vampweed enemy boarders. Also actively put out fires and repair breaches.

This odd formula of Shell gas carries the nano-medbots from the medbay around the ship, allowing the effects of the medbay to spread anywhere on the ship. Also does minor damage to non-Shell/Vampweed enemy boarders.

This odd formula of Shell gas carries the nano-medbots from the medbay around the ship, allowing the effects of the medbay to spread anywhere on the ship. Also does minor damage to non-Shell/Vampweed enemy boarders.
Absorbs 10% of scrap into the hull, repairing it. Will not take scrap when your hull is at full capacity.
A very powerful set of plating which combines all effects of Rock Plating, Mantis Pheromones, and Slug Repair Gel.
A combination of Rock and Crystal armor with the exact same stats of both.
A combination of Slug Gel and Mantis Pheromones with the exact same stats of both.
Specialized Pre-Igniter tech that not only pre-ignites weapons, but also improves their fire rate by 15%.
Remarkable ammunition replication system that synthesizes warheads for your missile weapons using left-over scrap. Missile weapons do not use ammo, but consumes 15% scrap from all sources.
All encompassing hazard-handling security system, which automatically repairs breaches, puts out fires, and reduces suffocation damage by 50%.

Advanced cybernetics forged from Aether. Non-mechanical crew gain an extra 25% resistance to fire and suffocation, and 20% health. However, the foreign implants also slow the passive healing speed of affected crew by 33%.
Extremely powerful shielding powered by Aether batteries. Unlike standard Energy Shields, it has an integrity of 7 hitpoints. Also boosts standard shield charge rate by 20%.
Overcharged version of the Obelisks' signature Aether shielding. Has an integrity of 10 hitpoints, and also boosts standard shield charge rate by 45%.
Extremely powerful shielding powered by Aether batteries. Unlike standard Energy Shields, it has an integrity of 7 hitpoints. Also boosts standard shield charge rate by 20%.
Overcharged version of the Obelisks' signature Aether shielding. Has an integrity of 10 hitpoints, and also boosts standard shield charge rate by 45%.
YOU SHOULD NEVER SEE THIS - gives Siren slaves the mind control graphic.
A VERY STRANGE RED BUTTON INSTALLED ON YOUR SHIP BY SLUGS. A SMALL PLACARD UNDERNEATH SAYS IN ALL CAPS, "SATISFACTION GUARANTEED, BECAUSE YOU AREN'T GETTING YOUR MONEY BACK."
Single use combat augment that can be deployed before combat to deal 4 damage to either enemy engines, weapons, shields, drones, cloaking, or teleporter as well as their hull.

A well structured guide on emergency procedures. Adds extra options to last minute preparations before combat to produce fuel, convert missiles and droneparts, or even detonate extra missiles to sabotage enemy weapons.
These nanobots take ship parts dislodged from hostile vessels and convert it to metal to repair your hull at the start of ship combat. More power means more bots are available to convert enemy parts.
Only the Obelisks can understand how this strange and powerful device functions, but it is capable of manipulating reality to summon any hazard before combat.
Can expel electrified nebulous gases to create an ion storm before any fight.
A backup generator for use in combat. Removes the power and fuel cost of combat augments.
Jams the enemy targeting systems, weakening the enemy Weapon system by 2 bars. Does not work on Artillery. [Uses 2 power, 1 fuel, lasts 45 seconds]
Jams the enemy shield generator, weakening the enemy Shield system by 2 bars. [Uses 2 power, 1 fuel, lasts 45 seconds]
Jams the enemy shield generator, weakening the enemy Shield system by 2 bars. [Uses 2 power, 1 fuel, lasts 45 seconds]
Disables the enemy engines, weakening the enemy Engines system by 2 bars. [Uses 2 power, 1 fuel, lasts 45 seconds]
Can be used to either disable enemy auto pilot for free, or completely shut off their evasion for 2 power.
Deploys an array of tracking flares that temporarily reveal the enemy, disabling their Cloaking system. [Uses 2 power, lasts 30 seconds]
Creates a protective field around the ship which can be tuned to protect against either enemy teleporter or mind control but not both at the same time. [Uses 2 power, lasts 30 seconds]
Activates an EMP field which cripples the enemy reactor, but is quite heavy on your own. Will not work on the Flagship. [Uses 3 power and 1 fuel, lasts 45 seconds]
Activates an EMP field which cripples the enemy reactor, but is quite heavy on your own. Will not work on the Flagship. [Uses 3 power and 1 fuel, lasts 45 seconds]

Cripples the enemy Oxygen system. Uses more power for each bar of Oxygen disabled. [Uses 4 to 6 power, infinite duration]
	[Note: The Emergency generator will only reduce power usage by 2]
A dangerous bio-engineered virus. Uses no power and reduces enemy and player Oxygen power by 2.
Ancient combat augment that limits a system on both the enemy and player ship to either 0 or 1 bar depending on the system. The player must have the system being targeted.
A portable ASB platform that can be deployed before combat by spending a single drone part and fuel.
Can be used at an empty beacon to awaken the ancient in your cargo-bay.
This strange machine is in a hibernating state. Perhaps someone will have more information about this.
A Federation supply crate given to you by Vice Admiral Adara. It's protected by several passcodes and a lock that requires a special magnetic key. A large Federation insignia is on the back.
A plastic statue painted gold depicting a Zoltan meditating. It appears to be something you could find in just about any tourist location.
You managed to retrieve this from the smuggler's depot, now you just have to bring it back.
Rare and expensive nebula gases. Sells for 50 scrap.
Parts salvaged from a damaged beacon. Maybe you can give them to the Beacon Eater?
The corpses of dead Orchid children, though they merely resemble small flowers. You can sell them for scrap, at the cost of your soul, you monster.

A bundle of highly illegal drugs. Using them yourself is out of the question if you don't want to be comatose by the time you get to the Flagship, but you could sell these back for more than you got them, or use them to bribe Slugs out of fighting you. Has no use outside the Royal Nebula.
You have been blessed by the Lost Suns. At empty beacons, you can hold a fire ritual to receive a reward.
You have been blessed by the Zoltans. At empty beacons you can meditate, which takes a long time but will repair your hull.

Reduces Ghost sabotage damage by 20%. If a Door Control system is present, all enemy crew and drones on-board (including anaerobic crew) will take a base damage of 2hp/s with an extra 1hp for each level of Door Control above 1.
Adds a death effect to all non-Zoltan allied crew, making them explode for 15 crew damage against enemies, with a 50% chance to start fires. Does not override crew that already have death effects.
Weapons are made immediately available after an FTL jump.

Detects and reveals the locations of Loot Transports and Guard Reinforcements when possible.
	Loot Transports are usually found in [!] Unique sectors.
	Guard Reinforcements spawn when a guard ship is killed.
A machine designed for casinos. It appears to have been modified to be able to dispense a wide variety of items when you win, but you can't seem to figure out how to open it.
Allows you to track down Ghost vessels from a long running database and fight them for scrap.
Allows you to track down Ghost vessels from a long running database and fight them for scrap.

Can single out and hijack the MV drives of powerful Multiverse cruisers from other realities. Uses 7 fuel to do so, but can spawn any MV boss as a Quest. Always spawns them at Challenge difficulty scaling.

Can be activated during hyperspeed to travel so insanely fast that you'll be put 3 jumps ahead of the Rebel fleet. Unfortunately, it's very unstable (and illegal), and will likely destroy your engines afterwards. Can only be used once.

A mystical square artifact with bright green lights and a dark black exterior. With it came a small card from the pirates, on it written "Open the box if you dare, but be warned. For as likely it is that it will grant you infinite power, it is just as likely to damn you."
Also known as a Karthithe, this box holds both divine wonders and unimaginable horrors. Question is, which will be bestowed upon you if you open it?
Boarders take damage over time on your ship at 2.7hp/s. The name makes it sound a lot more violent than it is.
Boarders take damage over time on your ship at 2.7hp/s. The name makes it sound a lot more violent than it is.
All ship systems have additional plating that provides a 15 percent chance to negate damage when hit (YOU SHOULD NEVER SEE THIS BY THE WAY)
Enemy boarders sabotage your systems at 40% speed. Also provides a 15% chance to resist damage to your systems.
Enemy boarders sabotage your systems at 40% speed. Also provides a 15% chance to resist damage to your systems.
A mysterious device set to broadcast into space far beyond the reach of your FTL drive. It's uncertain what will happen if you activate it...
Adds additional info about nearby Beacons on the star map.
A recycler module similar to that used in Recycler tech weapons. Can be used to convert fuel, scrap, drone parts, or just random junk into missiles.
A special component that allows you to disassemble missiles or droneparts into scrap, at a greatly reduced yield.
Patented GHOST DUPLICATING technology allows you to quickly and rapidly inflate Ghosts of any type, then force them to divide as if they were an Alpha. It's painless, we promise.
Can summon a store at any empty beacon at the cost of 1 fleet boost.
Allows you to deploy buoys during jumpspeed. Can give 1 fleet delay for free, or deploy additional buoys using droneparts.
Can be used to map the next sector while in jumpspace at the cost of 3 fuel.

Hyper efficient fuel conservation mixed with a bit of science mumbo-jumbo not only lets you conserve the fuel used with a sector jump, but also generate another fuel cell as well! Still requires you to have at least 1 fuel to make the jump first.

A module that drowns out distress or other signals. Can be used to prevent guards from calling for ASB backup or disable enemy attack satellites.
	
	Provides helpful blue options during relevant events.

Combat augment that can neutralize enemy Hacking systems. Also performs well against malicious viruses from enemy satellites or other sources. [Uses 2 power, lasts 30 seconds]
	
	Provides helpful blue options during relevant events.

A self-replenishing supply of holographic flares that make excellent distractions in situations where enemies or satellites are nearby but have not yet locked onto your vessel. Useful for sneaking into places or away from enemies.
	
	Provides helpful blue options during relevant events.

Advanced scanning device that can access the diagnostic and auditory logs of various devices to get useful information.
	
	Provides helpful blue options during relevant events.

A fake Rebel identification card, often used by smugglers to get past security checkpoints. While it's unlikely this'll work on high ranking Rebel officers or aggressive vessels who've already identified you as Federation, it should be enough to convince those less certain about your identity, or at least those who aren't very good at their jobs.
	
	Provides helpful blue options during relevant events.
Outfits your crew with superior firearms, adding an additional 30% (of default value) to damage in ranged combat. Does not affect drones.
Life support now prioritizes your crew, refilling oxygen 65% faster in rooms where crew are present. Requires oxygen to be powered, scales with power.
Can be opened at empty beacons. Can contain anywhere from 5 to 10 fuel.
Can be opened at empty beacons. Can contain anywhere from 5 to 10 missiles.
Can be opened at empty beacons. Can contain anywhere from 5 to 10 droneparts.
data/blueprints.xml.append$/FTL/FTL[7]/F: Standard issue defense Laser. Typically used only as a replacement when more expensive weapons aren't available.
Standard Burst Laser weapon. Power efficient and affordable, but not too flashy either.
Improved Burst Laser weapon. Still very efficient, but requires more power.
An advanced Burst Laser weapon with an impressively large barrage.
The strongest of the Burst Laser line. Though not sold to common ships, this Laser can fire the largest array of any other Laser.
Heavy Lasers are limited in projectiles compared to Burst Lasers, but do twice as much damage.
An upgraded Heavy Laser that fires an additional projectile.
An advanced Heavy Laser that fires 3 high-damage projectiles.
Heavy lasers are limited in projectiles compared to Burst Lasers, but do twice as much damage. Cooldown gets quicker with each volley.
A specialized Heavy Laser weapon that pierces an additional shield barrier.
A specially designed military Laser that does higher damage against rooms without systems.
Upgraded variant of the Anti-Hull Laser which fires an additional projectile but uses more power.
Advanced Anti-Hull Laser that fires 4 shots in total. Can be devastating if used to target systemless rooms.
A specially designed military Laser that does higher damage against rooms without systems. Cooldown gets quicker with each volley.
A faster charging assault Laser which can be used to take down shields quickly, but does no system or crew damage.
An upgraded Light Laser which fires extremely quickly and can keep a shield barrier under constant suppression.
A unique assault Laser that can pierce additional shield layers.
A unique assault Laser that can pierce additional shield layers.
An upgraded Pierce Laser that can fire enough projectiles to get through 4 layers of shields!
An upgraded Pierce laser that can fire enough projectiles to get through 5 shields!
This dual shot Laser decreases in cooldown the more it fires.
This Laser weapon takes a long time to warm up. Each time it fires it decreases the cooldown, eventually able to take down any amount of shields.
This Laser weapon can charge multiple projectiles, or fire its volley early.
This Laser weapon can charge multiple projectiles, or fire its volley early.
This Laser weapon can charge multiple projectiles, or fire its volley early.
This Laser weapon can charge multiple projectiles, or fire its volley early.
This Laser can charge 2 shots, but also shoots quicker with each volley.
This Laser can charge 2 shots, but also shoots quicker with each volley.
Laser weapon that adapts to its situation, increasing its damage with every 2 volleys shot.
A modified Laser weapon which starts a fire with each projectile, as well as harming enemy systems and hull but not crew.
This special Heavy Laser weapon is modified to temporarily stun crew in the room it hits.
Frost Lasers are one of the few weapon types capable of locking down rooms, keeping most crew from entering or leaving.
Frost Lasers are one of the few weapon types capable of locking down rooms, keeping most crew from entering or leaving.
Frost Lasers are one of the few weapon types capable of locking down rooms, keeping most crew from entering or leaving.
A specialized Laser that does high bio damage and cripples crew, but no system or hull damage.
Shoots streamlined bolts that cannot damage the hull or crew, but do heavy system damage.
Shoots streamlined bolts that cannot damage the hull or crew, but do heavy system damage.
A long concentrated Beam that annihilates systems and lights fires, but does no damage to the hull or crew.
Each missile contains its own particle accelerator, which upon contact with the enemy ship will do massive damage to systems and start fires.
Each missile contains its own particle accelerator, which upon contact with the enemy ship will do massive damage to systems and start fires.
A strange modified particle weapon that now leaks ion energy. It cannot do system damage, but does 5 ion damage to whatever system it hits, as well as shields if they are up.
A simple ion weapon which can temporarily take down a shield barrier.
A simple ion weapon which can keep a shield barrier offline.
An upgraded ion weapon which can keep multiple shield barriers offline.
An advanced ion weapon which can keep many shield barriers offline.
A heavy hitting ion weapon which charges much slower, but does significantly more ion damage on impact.
A less accurate ion weapon efficient at taking down shields, but not quite as useful against targeted systems. You can call it a Trion, if you'd like.
This Ion weapon uses no power, charges instantly, and fires a strong ion beam capable of taking out enemy shields very effectively. However, it can only be shot once per battle.
This weapon's Ion damage increases each time it fires to a max of 5.
This ion weapon can charge multiple times, giving it additional projectiles.
This ion weapon can charge multiple times, giving it additional projectiles.
Stun weapons function much like normal ions, but also temporarily paralyze crew in the same room that they hit.
Stun weapons function much like normal ions, but also temporarily paralyze crew in the same room that they hit.
A heavy hitting ion weapon which charges much slower, but does significantly more ion damage on impact. Also has additional stun properties.
This ion weapon can charge multiple times, giving it additional projectiles. Also has additional stun properties.
This ion weapon can charge multiple times, giving it additional projectiles. Also has additional stun properties.
Phasers pierce all shield layers, dealing ion damage for the first layer of shields, as well as additional damage to whatever system hit.
Phasers pierce all shield layers, dealing ion damage for the first layer of shields, as well as additional damage to whatever system hit.
Phasers pierce all shield layers, dealing ion damage for the first layer of shields, as well as additional damage to whatever system hit.
Ion weapons can disable systems without causing hull damage. This one starts fires in the system it hits.
What's a radion you ask? Well, it's an ion, but with radiation. Something like that. Very useful for asphyxiation kills.
An extremely weak missile weapon that does minor damage, but can provide extra fire support until you can acquire better weaponry.
A standard Missile Launcher with reasonable bang for its buck.
A heavy hitting Missile weapon that does large damage to the enemy hull.
These Missiles are designed to cause maximum destruction to ship hull armor.
These Missiles are designed to cause maximum destruction to ship hull armor.
Burst Missiles fire multiple low damage warheads for the price of one through patented replication technology.
Burst Missiles fire multiple low damage warheads for the price of one through patented replication technology.
Burst Missiles fire multiple low damage warheads for the price of one through patented replication technology.

While useless as an actual weapon, the power core provides immense amounts of power to the weapons to the right of it. [In order for weapons to function, there must be at least one normal reactor power allocated to the weapon system]

[Current Mode: Recon] A recon tool designed by the Federation to surveil on enemies from a distance and train gunmen, or lure out enemies with holographic bait. Can be toggled between recon mode for quick cooldown or bait mode to spawn holograms that last for 20 seconds.
[Current Mode: Bait] A recon tool designed by the Federation to surveil on enemies from a distance, or lure out enemies with holographic bait. Can be toggled between recon and bait modes.

An antique weapon from the Federation-Mantis War. While very outdated, it pierces 2 shields, creates breaches, and most importantly creates deep lashes in crew that will cause them to bleed, losing 1hp/s for 25 seconds every time they get hit.
No weapon has ever sparked a larger ethical controversy, but if it works it works. Currently has no crew assigned.
