data/blueprints.xml.append$/FTL/FTL[10]/: This modified Kestrel has been through a lot. It has been outfitted with a Multiverse drive and is one of the first ships to achieve dimensional travel.
A modified Federation cruiser armed with a powerful Artillery Beam and well trained crew.
When outfitting various Federation owned cruisers with Multiverse travel, the Stealth cruiser was decided to be an optimal choice because of its speed and well.. stealthiness.
The Harmony has taken interest in creating one collective conscience across dimensions, and ships like these are tasked in defending it.
This small civilian merchant discovered the Multiverse is no friendly place, and so took it upon himself to arm his ship with a decent boarding crew.
This Crystalline vessel was one of the intrepid few to leave behind the crystalline origins and journey off into the Multiverse.
A not-so-traditional boarding vessel that will force you to use tactics you might not be accustomed to.
A strange vessel from another far distant reality, carrying a strange Lanius crew from a distant land, and some powerful ancient tech.
The original Multiverse cruiser, though it has been through quite a lot in its travels.
A modified MV Cruiser outfitted to survive even the harshest of conditions.

A refurbished and improved version of the Proto-MV Cruiser with an additional impulse drive that allows it to escape combat. However due to instabilities caused by the augment, if the hull gets too low, unexpected technical failures may begin to occur.

The Rebellion's super-weapon, captured and reverse engineered by Federation recovery teams. With a few minor refurbishings, this ship is still very powerful, but does not support systems it doesn't start with.
The next stage of the Flagship, more damaged and missing an artillery but now with a heavier focus on drones.
The final stage of the Flagship, heavily damaged but still very deadly.
A standard civilian cruiser, more interested in keeping its crew well protected and comfortable than actual offensive power.
This ship was not installed with a proper medical system, nor does it boast anything better than a mediocre boarding team. To compensate, the crew must rely on their medic to keep them alive.
The former ship of a former merchant. Though its owner was killed by Mantis warlords, the Federation was able to salvage his ship along with his merchant beacon.
This massive cruiser is the forefront of the Militia's arsenal. Well armed and staffed, it's far better than you'd expect for a civilian militia to pull together.
A specialized militia cruiser that eliminates the enemy through boarding techniques without actually risking their civilian crew.
A special ops Militia cruiser assisted by some extra elite manpower. With advanced stealth technology, the enemies won't even see this ship coming.
A boring and outdated human vessel originally produced by the Federation. These ships are suddenly much more popular with the boom of Multiverse travel.
This ship was designed by a laser aficionado who looked at the old Red-Tail and said 'I can do that better'. This design is even faster firing, but lacks ability to damage systems.
This boarding vessel comes only with human crew, but is able to protect itself adequately while in combat.
This ship is equipped with a powerful Artillery Beam that tears through enemy ships.
This ship was created by a crazed pirate obsessed with the piece of tech loved by no other creature - Mine Launchers.
This ship is armed with a deadly fire-based Artillery Beam.
An advanced stealth cruiser built for speed and evasion over high offensive power.
A stealth ship wielding only a single Beam weapon that gets stronger with every time you fire it.
This ship specializes in manipulating the enemy ship while it stays hidden with its Cloaking system.
This vessel has all the potential to be a very powerful warship, but thanks to Senator Wright's insistent budget cuts, it doesn't have the most glorious start.
A powerful Federation Cruiser whose artillery system packs a much larger punch than usual, but lacks in standard defenses.
Using reverse engineered Federation artillery tech and weaponry similar to that of the Flagship, this powerful cruiser packs a serious punch.
This ship comes armed with a deadly Beam artillery, but cannot easily penetrate shields without the help of its otherwise lackluster weapons.
This ship has a large array of Anti-Bio tech at its disposal, yet struggles to penetrate the enemy's defenses without its artillery.
This massive cruiser was created for the Engineer corps. It comes well protected by drone tech and a staff of engineers.
This vast battleship came with one critical flaw - with no medical systems pre-installed, it must rely on its medical drones to heal its crew.
This cruiser, despite its size, has only one crew running it. As such, it must rely on its staff of Manager drones to run the rest of the ship.
A massive Rebel warship built for colonizing and conquering new realities.
Armed with a large supply of garbage from across the multiverse, this ship comes equipped with a modest arsenal of Flak weaponry.
By the time the scribbled over blueprints of this cruiser signed by one 'beam master' had been found, the ship had already completed construction.
Somewhat ironically now in service for the Federation, this vessel of ex-Rebel supersoldiers hopes to see the fall of the Universe 1 fleet.
Carrying nothing but a one man army, this vessel is prepared to protect its lone soldier at all costs.
After turning against the Rebellion, this Ace and his unusual companions joined together. Though their combined prowess is unmatched, their budget is poor.
Powered by the mind of C.I.C.A. and suited with the finest tech money can buy, this ship can carry a powerful array of weapons and drones but has very limited space for potential crew.
This ship comes suited for heavy drone use, but cannot install the life support systems necessary for most crew.
Though still powered by advanced AI, this ship is instead staffed by a suplementary organic crew rather than drones.
Not all Rebels agree with Vance's violent genocides, but old habits die hard, even for this team of Rebel turncoats.
This ship has a very sporadic defense system, but if given enough time, its artillery can devastate the enemy ship.
A stolen prototype ship originally stolen by the Smugglers. To what faction it originally belonged is unknown, as parts from many other ships have been welded onto it.
This ship is built around using the Rebel fleet as a source of scrap. While risky, the stolen Rebel transponder on this ship lets you track down Rebel elites at the cost of a small fleet boost.
This ship wields peculiar tech that allows it to produce explosive payloads for use in combat.
The personalized ship of the famous pirate Tuco himself. With some minor modifications and repairs, this ship remains weaker than other ships in hull, but it starts off incredibly strong.

Federation Multiverse scouts managed to retrieve the original model of Tuco's Cruiser before its capture. Turns out, it was a mobile casino. It's been outfitted properly for combat, but the gambling equipment remains.
After a successful bout of gambling, Tuco became so rich that he was able to build a ship whose hull is made almost entirely out of gold.
The Angels are some of the finest mercenaries in the galaxy. This stealth ship must rely on its deadly crew to kill the enemy quickly before it takes too much damage.
This stealth ship's main weapon takes too long to charge for its cloaking to cover it alone. To make up for this, it relies on other methods of sabotage.
Fire isn't known for its speed, though it makes an excellent method of causing chaos aboard the enemy ship. However, this stealth ship needs to light the enemy ablaze fast before it falls first.
The Brood uses a combination of dirty pirate tactics and many angry spiders to take care of its enemies.
This ship excels in trapping the enemy crew in webs while their ship burns, but its crew are also extra vulnerable to fire.
This cruiser wields one of the strangest weapons ever constructed in the galaxy.
A ship belonging to the infamous Spider Hunter. The design of the ship is a bit on the nose, but you should know better than to point that out to him.
A strange vessel inhabited by the exotic Morphs, who seems to be imitating the spiders this ship was originally designed for.
This cruiser once belonged to an esteemed Shell biologist studying the G.A.S., but after her untimely death the Spiders have now taken control of the ship.
Although it may look like a pile of junk loosely held together, this well designed ship relies on drones and ion weaponry.
This Engi Cruiser lacks proper shielding, but has 2 defense drones to protect it.
A perfect union between the 3 Engi sub-types, working together for a common goal they can all agree on.
A lonesome Separatist Engi pilots this ship without aid of an extensive crew, but with the company of his personnel drones he can manage.

This ship comes with one fatal flaw: its bottom and upper sections are separated. Luckily all of the systems that can be manned are located in the upper segment, but you must rely on drones to repair and protect the bottom.
This ship has limited fire power, but can utilize the power of its crew to distract enemy crew while its drones assault the enemy.
The Engi Harmony values drone tech highly, so it is of no surprise this ship relies on drones for various purposes.
The Zoltan's advanced shields technology gives this ship an edge during each battle.
This Zoltan cruiser does not come with any form of shields, but rather two specialized Overcharger drones.
This cruiser is capable of crippling enemy reactors, but as a result has virtually no reactor of its own and must rely on Zoltan crew and Conservative weapons.
A Duskbringer warship responsible for taking the lives of many. Now, it's in your hands, and no doubt it's going to take many more.
Though it's usually best for Duskbingers to wait to take full advantage of combat, this ship needs to kill the enemy crew quickly as its defenses are not up to par.
This ship comes considerably understaffed - forcing you rely on Recon drones to sabotage enemy systems and aid your crew in their suicidal mission.
Though the Monks' pacifist ways prevent them from inflicting harm on the enemy themselves, nothing says they cannot use other, "indirect" methods of neutralization.
This cruiser was given only ion-type weaponry to defend itself. While it might be an absolute pain, if you're crafty you might be able to crew kill ships like this...
The monks aboard this ship critically misunderstood their faith. The only reason this ship exists is that its crew don't have to directly kill the enemy.
A Zoltan military ship produced by the last few surviving organic Zoltan Osmians. It might not carry familiar Zoltan technology, but it's far from outdated in terms of weaponry.
Though Zoltans are not traditionally known for direct hand-to-hand combat anymore, the Osmians are much more competent and less suicidal than their hard-light successors.
This science vessel carries an array of recovered cryo-chambers holding ancient Osmians. With a little bit of fuel, they can finally be freed.
This cruiser relies almost entirely on the manpower of its Zoltan crew, and its large barrage of Energy weapons.
Using a dubious method of combat, this cruiser relies on the explosive nature of its crew to repeatedly suicide bomb the enemy ship.
This warship is designed to enhance its crew for close combat missions.
Unlike most Mantis ships, this cruiser does not come with a Crew Teleporter. Instead, it teleports many explosives thanks to its powerful array of Bomb Launchers.
Few things are quite as chaotic as a Mantis fighting aboard a ship ablaze.
The Free Mantis work in close relation with the Federation, and as such their ships host a wide range of crew and weaponry.

While building this ship, the designers ran low on budget while trying to fit in a Cloaking system. Now, it only has room for a smaller Teleporter, so you must use stealth to protect yourself before you can send in more crew.
This ship is equipped with a Zoltan Shield in return for its Shield Bypass. However, it lacks in reactor power to properly sustain its systems.
The Suzerain are a powerful group of Mantis warlords, and the size of their ship is a sign of their power. This powerful warship will make any enemy shake in their boots.
Though this ship has no shields, its strong boarding crew and additional systems provide strong alternatives.
This ship is armed to cause hell on the enemy ship, but its boarding crew are also at a particular risk.

This cruiser was once the only of its kind, but now it's been reproduced over millions of different realities. Unfortunately the blueprints for it were incomplete and some of the systems start in disrepair.
The original prototype of the Bishop cruiser, one of the first ships to have ever been installed with cloaking tech.
This cruiser specializes in incapacitating the enemy crew while the boarding team causes havoc.
This Mantis ship was the original design for the Suzerain cruiser, but was eventually outclassed by the newer models.
An older model of the Bishop cruisers, refitted to be one of the strongest traditional boarding ships in the multiverse.
This ship is a fearsome boarding cruiser, but lacks much ability to defend itself while its crew are away.
Similar to its designers, this super-dense behemoth uses brute force to overwhelm its foes.
This Rock ship comes armed with only missile tech, usually a massive downside. However, it is also capable of turning excess materials into ammunition.
This Rock ship lacks Shields, but has a special augment that can be improved at empty beacons for potentially extreme protection.
With limited onboard capacity, the crew of this vessel must take full advantage of their teamwork to, as the saying goes, "make the dream work".
Though this ship might not come with a weapon system, its teleporter is large enough to send over the ship's entire crew at once!
This ship might lack a proper medical system, but it can more than make up for it thanks to its reconstructive teleporter.

Though poorly armed, this vessel carries a team of powerful commandos who can light the enemy ship ablaze and punch their way to victory. Maybe if you kill your opposition quickly enough, the guilt of your actions will go away.
The Lost Suns and Crystals might not be close allies, but one cannot deny their abilities work well together, enough so to warrant a vessel that takes advantage of both.
With no direct damaging weapons, this vessel will have to rely on the different modes of its drones to determine whether it'll cause chaos with fires or destroy the enemy's hull.
Originally tasked with the defense of Numa V from hostile invaders, this ship has taken a detour to protect the Federation. Why? God knows.

Fortunately for this band of slow moving crew, all of the most important of their key systems are conveniently close together. However, the rest of the ship's most vital systems are disconnected and impossible to reach.
This ship must carefully manage the health of its incredibly tanky crew to its advantage, as it has neither airlocks nor the ability to install a Medbay!
This cruiser belongs to the legendary Salt Man, a fearsome bounty hunter outlawed in just about all of Slug territory.
This cruiser was designed by the Salt Man so that he could sit back and watch the enemy ship in peace as chaos goes down.
This cruiser was once an old mining ship, before it was repurposed as a boarding vessel by the one and only Salt Man.
This powerful vessel is powered by the secret technologies of the lost Crystalline Beings.
This Crystal ship might have no airlocks, but its crew are well suited to low oxygen environments and are adept at boarding.
This Crystal ship specializes in teleporting its crew aboard to lockdown enemy systems, then burning the enemy crew alive with several fire weapons.
The strangely well equipped "peace-vessel" of the SSLG. It has little in ways of protecting itself from enemy boarders however, besides the capabilities of its own crew.
This ship carries a very powerful arsenal of Beams but struggles to get through Shields without its crew.
Though this ship comes with limited defenses and not much damage output from its weapons, its unique armor provides it with an unusual and masochistic advantage.
A massive and incredibly well protected cruiser owned by the Cult of the Eternal Ember.
The Cultists' amplified abilities make them excellent boarders, but risky if you cannot manage their health.
This ship has a painfully inefficient room layout, so your drug-addicted cult following must subject themselves to more injections just to get from place to place.
A powerful Rock cruiser armed with an incredible barrage of missiles with a massive ammunition supply.
The armor on this vessel is much stronger than the average ship, meaning it can tank damage almost indefinitely.
When a recovery team stumbled across the Carnelian, they were surprised to find it still functional albeit in need of some revamps, and with a note attached that read "crystal b best ship".
Designed for use inside nebulas, this cruiser lacks sensors and relies instead on the guile and cunning of the Slugs.
This Slug ship specializes in asphyxiating enemy crew.

This Slug Cruiser has been armed with specialized Anti-Bio drone technology. Due to the randomized nature of drone targeting, they can't always be relied upon, so as backup it also comes with a Shield jamming combat augment.
The Clansmen, members of the Exotic Hunters guild, take pride in their hobbies of murdering other people and displaying their corpses as trophies.
A ship built for taking out crew at long range with Anti-Bio weaponry. After all, professionals have standards.
This ship has no medical facilities, so you must rely on stun technology to keep enemy crew neutralized.
Hektar Industries(tm) introduces the new Hektar Cruiser(tm)! Cruise the stars in comfort and enjoy the benefits of modular weaponry right aboard your very own ship.
The pleasures of both capitalism AND genocide brought straight to your door! Swap between Anti-Bio and Hull damaging properties with your weapons to fit your chosen strategy.
This cruiser comes armed with an array of Modular missiles, and Recycler tech to make use of them.

A large Slug ship designed for Slug pleasure cruises. The floor is stickier than usual and you feel dirty just being near the thing, but if this is what it takes to defeat the Rebellion, then so be it.

The engineers designing this ship decided a mobile nightclub would require no defenses other than a psychedelic cloak. Though it does not do a good job at concealing the ship, it is bright enough to blind the enemy.

A clan of Ghosts managed to obtain a stolen Slug pleasure barge. Unsure how to use a large portion of the strange looking weapons and torture devices inside, they have refitted the ship as they see fit.
This small cruiser might have little hull, but it still exists as the KoN's flagship vessel. It's not the size that matters, but the way you use it.
Though this vessel is armed in fire-starting tech, it lacks the sensors to properly assess where the fire is spreading.
This ship carries no Shields or Cloaking to protect it; its crew must quickly sabotage the enemy systems, and use repair technology to save itself.

The Hackers are a deadly group of Slugs who, as their name would suggest, excel at creating chaos through hacking. This ship cannot pierce any shields with its Beam, so it must rely on the Hacking system.
This cruiser uses a combination of lockdown tech and Hacking to trap its enemies while the crew board.
This cruiser wields a powerful Combustion Drone and Particle Beam that can start fires and cause system damage, but cannot pierce shields without help from its Hacking system.
The powerful cruiser belonging to the one and only Sylvan, the traveling merchant.
A tale as old as time, two lovers determined to stay together despite all the odds. Oh, and they also have a massive warship.
It's a beautiful day outside. Birds are singing, flowers are blooming. Time to show those Rebels a bad time.
A deadly elite Slug ship that specializes in stealth, hacking, and manipulation, at the expense of Shields.
This Slug vessel was built for some of Nights' more... lustful pleasures, but when he got bored of it, he gave it away to the military.
The Shells value high defense on their ships over overwhelming offense.
The Shells and Vampweeds have held strong economic relations for years, but besides even that, their natural abilities complement each other very well.
This colorful Shell vessel bears crew from all 4 districts, and relies on the combination of their abilities to make do.
This large Shell cruiser protects its crew very well, but has a somewhat difficult time taking out the enemies quickly.
This ship comes with a detached Medbay, meaning you must rely on the special gas to heal you. However, while your Medbay is damage resistant to weapons, it is not immune to fire and boarders!
Without any medical systems to start, this ship will rely entirely on its crew to heal.
The Shell Mechanics are in charge of most of the Geniocracy's infrastructure management. This cruiser serves both utility and combat purposes.
This more militarized Shell vessel was captured by the Mantis, but it still retains one of its original crew to help with repairs.
This psychedelically colored Shell vessel has no shields, and only a basic Stealth system. It must rely on its crew for quick repairs, and repair-bot dispersal to heal itself.

Splop urg yooj, kip kip oogl sprug. Youl erp, roo koo urple! Though the original description of this ship is completely unrecoverable, it appears this modified Shell cruiser carries one of their failed genetic experiments - the Morphs.
This Morph vessel has a very strange design. Unable to use most of its drones, your Technopaths must take on their forms to run the functions aboard your ship.
This rusty Shell vessel is inhabited by both Morphs and Ghosts. Who captured the ship first? We don't know...
This cruiser's defenses are incredibly strong. However, due to the Shell's weaknesses and fear of asphyxiation, it comes with no airlocks.
The Leech military was once vast and powerful - and though those days are long gone, this cruiser manages to recapture some of that old glory.
This Leech ship was lucky to be armed with quick firing Beam technology ahead of their usual standards - except it cannot pierce any shields without the aid of its crew!
This peculiar ship focuses on keeping its enemies disabled for as long as possible while your weapons slowly peck away at the enemy.
This ship is the hallmark of Alkram's revolution. It's a powerful boarding ship, but the layout does not take the urgent medical needs of non-regenerative crew into mind.
The designers of this ship forgot to take into account one important detail when they left out the medical system - most crew aren't capable of regeneration.
This ship specializes in suffocating the enemy through the use of its unique set of crew.
Though it's not equipped for boarding nor does it boast a very strong starting loadout, this hefty cruiser can sell off its excess cargo to passing vessels.
Though suited for combat, this ship comes with a critical flaw - it simply cannot install a medical system, and must rely on other methods to heal.
Taking a page out of the Duskbringers' books, this ship shows little to no regard for the lives of its crew as it continuously throws them at the enemy ship.
The Coalition is made up of 4 dangerous multiversal empires whose crew when together can be a very deadly threat.
This cruiser is staffed by an unusual mix of allies to form the "Anti-Coalition". Not to be confused with the Federation.
Though the Coalition might typically opt for boarding strategies, this vessel is geared much more towards defense instead.
This powerful Leech ship can keep the most of the enemy's key systems offline for long periods of time, but has no weapons!
While this vessel may come with very little crew space, it is staffed by 4 of the strongest elites more than capable of handling enemy crews.
The Orchids might appear frail and vulnerable, but they are no force to be messed with in combat.
This Orchid ship doesn't need to power its oxygen all the time, and therefore feels the same way about its opponents, even if it's much deadlier for them.
Despite the Orchid race's weakness to fires, this ship draws power from solar flares to fuel its powerful but expensive Chain Kernel weapon.
Armed with deadly spore weapons and crewed by the carnivorous Vampweeds, this cruiser is one of the strongest models in the Vampweed armada.
While the Vampweeds make fearsome combatants, many actually choose to live more reserved lifestyles. This vessel does not start with a teleporter but is armed with many powerful spore weapons.
Though Orchids might normally be known for their reserved pacifist ways, this ship takes a much more close and personal approach.
The sharp knife-like structures make Lanius ships a sight to behold; this cruiser is one of their finest warships.

The Lanius race has little fear of hazards in their oxygenless environments. This ship is armed with a deadly Flak cannon able to switch between elements, which likely does not pass any existing safety regulations.
This Lanius Cruiser specializes in boarding and suffocating the enemy crew.

The Augmented live unstable and dangerous lives in their search for ancient metal. They couldn't care less about supporting other crew on this ship, but it comes armed with a powerful arsenal from times long forgotten...
This ship comes without built in medical systems, so its unique crew must heal through their assimilative abilities.
This cruiser carries an impressive missile arsenal that doesn't require ammunition. However, it struggles with gaining scrap for other necessities.
A massive Dynasty vessel geared for war. However, it's lower on crew than it should be, and has to rely on the unique characteristics of the Ghosts to help it out.
An older Dynasty warship from back in the glory days. Still armed with its original arsenal, what it lacks in accuracy it makes up for in firepower.
This massive but peculiar Dynasty ship is armed with technology from an era long forgotten by most of the Ghosts themselves.
This cruiser is owned by a group of cultists who worship a damaged ancient device which can summon additional Ghost crew at empty beacons.
This model of Spook Chaser ship was re-acquired by the Rebels. Instead of tracking Ghosts, it was repurposed to hunt particular Multiverse Renegades.
They're coming soon. Maybe you should think twice about opening the door.
Though this vessel has neither shields nor sealant to protect its systems, a good number of them are resistant.
This ship comes crewed by a team of Cognitives instead of a drone system. However, if your crew die, there'll be nothing left to repair your systems if they are breached.
This cruiser was developed by a long forgotten race of demi-god cubes. It might be incredibly strong, but... well it's just really strong.
This powerful Royal vessel comes equipped with a teleporter and Obelisk crew, but struggles with repairing and supporting other crew.
This vessel was once staffed by a third subset of the Obelisks that died off long ago during the intraspecies war. All that remains is a Cognitive and some Drones to staff the ship.
A powerful Lanius boarding ship that excels at suffocation and salvaging enemy ships.
This spectacularly massive elite vessel packs a serious punch once its weapons reach max chain power, but must rely on its powerful cloak to protect it.
A powerful Ghost ship built out of an old partially destroyed Kestrel Cruiser.
The suitably well armed cruiser belonging to the famous detective and Militia reformant.
Tully was one of the first Federation captains to receive the finished Federation cruiser prototype, though the real powerhouse of this vessel is Tully himself.
Yo ho ho, fiddledeedee, being a pirate is 103.
Jerry's experience with Vance has left him changed, but that won't stop him from going the way of peace... by killing every goddamn Rebel in his path.
The battleship of an infamous terrorist to some, and a noble hero to others. Either way, you're going to be killing a lot of people, but as they say, history is written by the victors.
This Engi outcast struggles to find a crew of Engi who would support him, but he was lucky enough to find some eager crew willing to do anything to help the Federation.
A glorious ship completely free from all spiritual propaganda and transformed into any mad scientist's dream.
Pip ploo yurgle tik jipoo MAJOO, jurg purg ripple tip tip pooj. POO ROO! POO ROO! POO ROO!
Small and cramped, this ship is a tight squeeze for all of the infamous Slug king's fans. That is, it would be, if he had any.

Nights might have taken the throne, but Slocknog gets to walk away with the award for the bigger ship at the end of day. Some might argue the size doesn't matter, but Slocknog will just pretend he couldn't hear you.
Now washed up from both his career in the EHG and spider hunting, Irwin has moved on to more pressing matters, like saving reality.
Despite being a veteran from the Federation-Mantis War, Alkram has few qualms with dog-piling his obedient soldiers onto the enemy lines in wreckless abandon.
King Tyrdeo is known for many things. Most of them aren't very good things, but you can't deny his ship has a very unique paintjob.

From the outside, this ship may appear to be the one of a ruthless killer. And make no mistake, it certainly is. But said killer also happens to be a fan of tea, crumpets, and good manners. These things are surprisingly not mutually exclusive with murder.
The personal cruiser of the infamous Mantis warrior/thief/poet/ladies' man/chef/handsome rogue, Kazaaakplethkilik.
The brightly colored personal cruiser of Empress Dianesh herself. Though it comes underarmed in terms of weaponry, its crew is formidable when working together.
For all the fires this ship may start, none can compete with the burning rage in Ariadne's heart for the Theocracy, Coalition, and maybe the Rebels too.
The golden cruiser of the Crystal Empire's foreign ambassador himself. Due to a chronic phobia induced from past life experiences, this ship has been kept deliberately stasis-pod free.
Having finally got his act together, Tuco can now be sober enough to purchase a new ship and a more competent crew to work with.

It could be said the old Lanius King and consumer of location-denoting devices is getting soft, and has rebuilt his ship to fit aerobes as well. This of course is a lie, it's impossible for a being of metal to actually be soft.

Sculpted out of the finest, rarest, and strongest metal in the galaxy, this cruiser is fit for a god. It's got something of that sort for a captain, though the truth of their mortality often gets in the way.
The sight of this massive war vessel is enough to intimidate any vessel in its path, but once they see the Prime Reaper himself aboard, they'll probably soil their pants. If they even wear them.
Grand Priest Lord Vortigon Obadann XIV, Devout Follower and Leader of the Cult of the Eternal Ember and Keeper of the Holy Texts's personal cruiser.
Two brothers, reunited at last in the spirit of capitalism. Isn't it beautiful?
Lizard uprising NOW! Down with capitalism! Up with tribal chieftain and blood moon polytheistic sacrificial rituals! Ooowooowoooowoooowooowoowowowoowoo!
This ship has been infested by the Spider Queen. It can fit a massive amount of crew aboard, and produce more spiders using the Queen.

On his eternal quest to find the last few survivors of his species, Obyn inevitably encountered more of himself searching across the realities. They can't exactly reproduce, but they can party the days away aboard this vessel.
Having thought they were finally safe from each other, these two former... acquaintances have now been forced back together to help save reality.
The gang's all here! This cruiser carries every single unique crew in the mod, and can fit quite a few too. Don't expect it to be balanced; that's not what it's here for.
No one's sure who authorized this vessel, or why. It just showed up one day, with a small sticky-note stuck to the side which reads "cry about it".
This class of ship was decommissioned from Federation service years ago. After a number of refits and updates this classic ship is ready for battle.
This modified Kestrel class ship was created by a laser weapon aficionado.
This model was modified by pirates to utilize newly discovered technology.  It can clone lost crewmembers and stun enemies.
Although it may look like a pile of junk loosely held together, this well designed ship relies on drones and ion weaponry.
Heavily understaffed, this ship relies on drones to keep the ship running.
The Engi were quick to adapt to the sudden surge of hacking technology - this ship is the result of their research.
This ship features the latest in Federation technology: an advanced beam weapon that pierces through shields.
This ship starts with additional Artillery power, encouraging heavy reliance on the beam.
With a Flak Artillery weapon and an improved Clonebay, only the most suicidal of infantry chooses to fly on this ship.
The Zoltan's advanced shields technology gives this ship an edge during each battle.
This ship starts with a weakened Shield system and must rely on its supershield.
The designer of this ship was not willing to spend the money for a decent reactor. Instead it relies on its Zoltan crew and Backup Battery.
This warship is designed to enhance its crew for close combat missions.
This warship encourages sending massive boarding parties and keeping strong defenses.
With a large teleporter and weapons designed to impede enemy crew, this ship is deadly in the hands of a capable boarding party.
Designed for use inside nebulas, this cruiser lacks sensors and relies instead on the guile and cunning of the Slugs.
This boarding ship has no medical facilities and must manage its explosives carefully to keep the crew alive.
Slugs are often skilled in the arts of misdirection and manipulation. With Hacking and Mind Control systems, this ship capitalizes on that fact.
Similar to its designers, this super-dense behemoth uses brute force to overwhelm its foes.
With no airlocks, this ship must rely entirely on its rock crew to put out fires.
Contact has been made with the Crystalline race and this cruiser was offered to the Federation as part of diplomatic discussions between the sister species.
Constructed for the Federation by the Engi, this ship is designed to use cloaking technology and speed to get behind enemy lines.
Built like a glass cannon, this ship is hard to handle. If its cloaking can keep it safe long enough to charge its weapon, few cruisers can withstand its might.
This ship was part of an Engi experiment to make a power efficient version of the Zoltan shield. Unfortunately this required the removal of the Cloaking system.
The sharp knife-like structures make Lanius ships a sight to behold. This cruiser was adapted to support the other races of the Federation.
The racial ability of the Lanius make them fearsome combatants in small quarters. Combine that with a Mind Control system and this ship is a force to be reckoned with.
This powerful vessel is powered by the secret technologies of the lost Crystalline Beings.
Their unique racial ability makes the Crystal beings very adept at ship boarding. This ship was designed for such raiding parties.
Feeling up for a challenge? This cruiser is very poorly optimized, and thus can only upgrade its systems to lower than normal thresholds.
Contrary to typical logic, this ship is not better than its Mk I version. In fact, it's quite worse.
By playing this ship, you sign away your right to have fun.
It is rumored that somewhere, in some dark crevice, some unholy forsaken land within the Multiverse, a ship was conceived. The final limit.
You bought this literal piece of junk for 500 scrap from a Ghost shop you didn't even think was real. Good job?
From the delinquent Ghosts who brought you the Crapbucket, we introduce you now to the one and only Piece of Shit.
In some far away universe where logic clearly didn't exist, someone decided to take the Crapbucket one step further, and invite an all-star cast with it.
Ever wanted to fly Sylvan's ship as you see it in-game? Well now you can! Just be aware, this thing really screws with the UI.
Sssome daysss you jussst don't feel like trying, eh ssstranger?
Bored of his life controlling the Multiverse from the sanctity of the Nexus, Sylvan Prime's decided to take being a Renegade for a spin, and brought along some friends.
A very strangely designed transport vessel used for equinoids.
Having finally decided to leave behind his old home, the Story Teller now travels among his equinoid companions.
This ship has a particularly vulnerable set of crew that must rely on their force of ponies to protect them.

Can't go wrong with the classics! This is the earliest rendition of this version of the Alpha Kestrel (recreated with a few liberties). It cannot support AE systems, so be careful you don't waste your scrap on them at stores!
Whoever authorized the crew of this vessel to be entirely Lanius severely misunderstood the implications of their greed.
Commissioned by LaRoache as his crowning jewel, this solid gold Leech ship might be dazzling, but it's also not really up to par for a military vessel.
After the last failure of Nights' attempt at a pleasure cruiser, he went full force with a complete redesign of a Pleasure Barge.
